tit.cmt: タイトルの補足を入れました。

sen.j: 続日本紀（しょくにほんぎ）は、平安時代初期に編纂された勅撰史書。
sen.e: Shoku Nihongi is a collection of history books by Imperial command which was compiled in the early Heian period.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Shoku Nihongi is a collection of history books compiled in the early Heian period according to imperial command.
Shoku Nihongi is a collection of history books which was compiled by Imperial command in the early Heian period.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: 『日本書紀』に続く六国史（りっこくし）の第二に当たる。
sen.e: It is the second book of the Rikkokushi (the Six National Histories), following "Nihon Shoki" (Chronicles of Japan).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It is the second book of the Rikkokushi (the Six National Histories), following "Nihon Shoki (Chronicles of Japan").
It is the second book of the Rikkokushi (the Six National Histories), and came out after "Nihon Shoki" (Chronicles of Japan).
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: 菅野真道らが延暦16年（797年）に完成した。
sen.e: SUGANO no Mamichi and others completed it in 797.
SUGANO no Mamichi and others completed it in 797.
SUGANO no Mamichi and others completed the book in 797.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: 文武天皇元年（697年）から桓武天皇の延暦10年（791年）まで95年間の歴史を扱い、全40巻から成る。
sen.e: It consists of forty volumes in total, covering ninety-five years from 697, the first year of the Emperor Monmu's reign, to 791, the reign of Emperor Kanmu.
It consists of 40 volumes and covers 95 years, from 697, the first year of the Emperor Monmu's reign, to 791, the reign of Emperor Kanmu.
It consists of 40 volumes in total and covers 95 years, ranging from 697, the first year of the Emperor Monmu's reign, to 791, the reign of Emperor Kanmu.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: 奈良時代の基本史料である。
sen.e: This history book is a fundamental material to know the Nara period.
This history book is fundamental to knowledge of the Nara period.
It is the fundamental historical material to know the Nara period.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。スペル修正しました。

sen.j: 編年体、漢文表記である。
sen.e: It was arranged in chronological order and written in classical Chinese.
It was arranged in chronological order and written in classical Chinese.
It was arranged in chronological order and written in classical Chinese.

sen.j: 編纂は、前半部と後半部で異なる事情を持つ。
sen.e: The first and the latter half of the book were compiled for different reasons.
The first and second halves of the book were compiled for different reasons.
The first and second halves of the book were compiled for different reasons.

sen.j: 前半ははじめ、文武天皇元年（697年）から天平宝字元年（757年）、孝謙天皇の治世までを扱う30巻の曹案として作られた。
sen.e: The first half of the book was originally planned to cover the years from 697, the first year of the Emperor Monmu's reign, to 757, the reign of Empress Koken, consisting of thirty volumes in total.
sen.cmt: 曹案の意味がわからなかったので、大体の意味を訳出しました。
sen.e: The first half of the book was originally planned to cover the years from 697, the first year of the Emperor Monmu's reign, to 757, the reign of Empress Koken, and was to consist of 30 volumes.

The first half of the book was originally planned to consist of 30 volumes in total and cover the years ranging from 697, the first year of the Emperor Monmu's reign, to 757, the reign of Empress Koken.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: 光仁天皇が、修正を石川名足、淡海三船、当麻永嗣に命じたが、彼らは天平宝字元年紀を紛失した上、未遂に終わった（この年の前後には政争絡みの事件も多かったため、執筆者間で意見が纏めることが出来ずに紛失という事にしたとする説もある）。
sen.e: Emperor Konin ordered ISHIKAWA no Natari, OMI no Mifune, and TAIMA no Nagatsugu to revise the plan, however, they lost A Record of the First Year of the Tenpyo Hoji Era and could not finish the work (there is an opinion that due to the many political conflicts which occurred before and after the year of 757, they could not reach an agreement about writing the history, so they pretended to lose it).

Emperor Konin ordered ISHIKAWA no Natari, OMI no Mifune, and TAIMA no Nagatsugu to revise the plan, but they lost A Record of the First Year of the Tenpyo Hoji Era and could not finish the work (there is an opinion that due to the many political conflicts that occurred before and after the year 757 they couldn't reach an agreement about writing the history, so they pretended that it had been lost).

Emperor Konin ordered ISHIKAWA no Natari, OMI no Mifune, and TAIMA no Nagatsugu to revise the work, but they lost A Record of the First Year of the Tenpyo Hoji Era and could not finish the revision (there is an opinion that due to the many political conflicts which occurred before and after the year 757, they could not reach an agreement about writing the history, so they pretended that it had been lost).
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。半角にしました。

sen.j: 桓武天皇の命により編纂を菅野真道、秋篠安人、中科巨都雄が引継ぎ、全20巻とした。
sen.e: SUGANO no Mamichi, AKISHINO no Yasuhito, and NAKASHINA no Kotsuo were ordered to complete the work by Emperor Kanmu, and they made it twenty volumes in total.
SUGANO no Mamichi, AKISHINO no Yasuhito and NAKASHINA no Kotsuo were ordered to complete the work by Emperor Kanmu, and thus it totaled 20 volumes.
Emperor Kanmu ordered SUGANO no Mamichi, AKISHINO no Yasuhito, and NAKASHINA no Kotsuo to complete the work, and thus the volumes totaled 20.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: 後半は当初、天平宝字2年（758年）からおそらく宝亀8年（777年）、淳仁天皇から光仁天皇までを扱うものとして、桓武天皇の命で編纂された。
sen.e: The latter half of the book was supposed to deal with the history from 758 to maybe 777, the reigns of Emperor Junnin to Emperor Konin, and compiled by order of Emperor Kanmu.
The latter half of the book was supposed to deal with the history from 758 to perhaps 777 (the reigns of Emperor Junnin to Emperor Konin), and was compiled by order of Emperor Kanmu.
Emperor Kanmu gave an order to compile the latter half of the book that was supposed to deal with the history dating from 758 to perhaps 777 (the reigns of Emperor Junnin to Emperor Konin).
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: 石川名足、上毛野大川が詔によって編集した20巻を、藤原継縄、菅野真道、秋篠安人が14巻に縮め、延暦13年（794年）にいったん完成した。
sen.e: The twenty-volume book compiled by ISHIKAWA no Natari and KAMITSUKENU no Okawa were reduced to fourteen volumes by FUJIWARA no Tsugutada, SUGANO no Mamichi, and AKISHINO no Yasuhito, and it was once completed in 794.
The 20-volume work compiled by ISHIKAWA no Natari and KAMITSUKENU no Okawa was reduced to 14 volumes by FUJIWARA no Tsugutada, SUGANO no Mamichi and AKISHINO no Yasuhito, and was completed in 794.

The 20-volume work which had been compiled by ISHIKAWA no Natari and KAMITSUKENU no Okawa was reduced to 14 volumes by FUJIWARA no Tsugutada, SUGANO no Mamichi, and AKISHINO no Yasuhito, then it was completed in 794.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。アラビア数字にしました。

sen.j: 菅野真道、秋篠安人、中科巨都雄は、さらに6巻、すなわち桓武天皇の治世のうち延暦10年（791年）までを加え、全20巻とした。
sen.e: SUGANO no Mamichi, AKISHINO no Yasuhito, and NAKASHINA no Kotsuo added six more volumes to the work, which covered the incidents that had occurred by 791in the reign of Emperor Kanmu, making it twenty volumes in total.

SUGANO no Mamichi, AKISHINO no Yasuhito and NAKASHINA no Kotsuo added six more volumes to the work, which covered the incidents that had occurred by 791 in the reign of Emperor Kanmu, thus bringing the total to 20 volumes.

SUGANO no Mamichi, AKISHINO no Yasuhito and NAKASHINA no Kotsuo added six more volumes to the work, which covered the incidents that had occurred before 791 in the reign of Emperor Kanmu, thus brought the total to 20 volumes.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: 以上あわせて40巻の編纂が成ったのは、延暦16年（797年）であった。
sen.e: Therefore the book in forty volumes was completed in 797.
Therefore, the book in 40 volumes was completed in 797.
It was in 797 that the work consisting of 40 volumes in total was completed.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: “日本”という国家が形成されていく過程を描いた『日本書紀』とその国家が形成された後の歩みを描いた『続日本史』以後の勅撰国史ではその内容に違いが生じてくる。
sen.e: There are differences in contents between the Imperial collections of history book, "Nihon Shoki," which described the process of a country "Japan" had been being unified and "Shoku Nihonshi," which dealt with the history after the country had been formed.

There are differences in contents between the imperial collections of the history books "Nihon Shoki," which described the process by which the country of "Japan" had been unified, and "Shoku Nihonshi," which dealt with the history of the country after its formation.

There are differences in contents between the imperial collections of the history books "Nihon Shoki," which described the process of unifying the country of "Japan," and "Zoku Nihonshi," which dealt with the history of the country after its formation.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。クォーテーションの位置、読みを変えました。

sen.j: また、律令制が整えられたことにより、内記や外記、図書寮などに不十分ながらも記録や公文書が蒐集される仕組が形成されてきた事が記録の充実をもたらすことになる。
sen.e: Thanks to the Ritsuryo system (a system of centralized government based on the ritsuryo code), a method for collecting records and official documents was developed -- though it was not perfect yet--, setting Naiki (Secretary of the Ministry of Central Affairs), Geki (Secretary of the Grand Council of State), and Zushoryo (the Bureau of Drawings and Books), which led the collection of records rich in content.

Thanks to the Ritsuryo system (a system of centralized government based on the ritsuryo code), a method of collecting records and official documents was developed--though it wasn't yet perfect--establishing the Naiki (Secretary of the Ministry of Central Affairs), Geki (Secretary of the Grand Council of State) and Zushoryo (the Bureau of Drawings and Books), which led to the collection of records that were rich in content.

Thanks to the Ritsuryo system (a system of centralized government based on the ritsuryo code), Naiki (Secretary of the Ministry of Central Affairs), Geki (Secretary of the Grand Council of State) and Zushoryo (the Bureau of Drawings and Books) developed a method of collecting records and official documents, although it was not yet perfect; this development led to the collection of records rich in content.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。though →although

sen.j: 全般に記述が簡潔で、事件の要点のみを記して詳細に及ばない。
sen.e: The book as a whole was written in brief, describing only the gist of the incidents and not mentioning the details.
The book as a whole was written in brief, describing only the gist of the incidents without mentioning the details.
As a whole, it was written concisely, and only the gist of the incidents was described, so it does not contain the details.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: 簡潔が過ぎて養老律令のような重要事件が脱落した例が見られる。
sen.e: It was sometimes so concise that important things such as Yoro ritsuryo code (code promulgated in the Yoro period) were omitted.
It was sometimes so concise that important things such as the Yoro ritsuryo code (code promulgated in the Yoro period) were omitted.
It was sometimes written so briefly that important things such as the Yoro ritsuryo code (code promulgated in the Yoro period) were omitted.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: 一部の人物の死亡記事に簡単な略伝を付し、これは後続の史書に踏襲された。
sen.e: Brief biographies were added to some of obituaries, which was to be continued by the following history books.
Brief biographies were added to some of the obituaries, and these were to be continued by the following history books.
The brief biographies were added to some of the obituaries, and this style was followed by the succeeding history books.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: このような略伝を特に薨伝（こうでん）という。
sen.e: Such biographies are called Koden.
Such biographies were called Koden.
Such biographies were called Koden.

sen.j: 政治的配慮は、桓武天皇の治世の記述において顕著である。
sen.e: The articles concerning the reign of Emperor Kanmu were written with extra consideration.
The articles concerning the reign of Emperor Kanmu were written with extra consideration.
The articles concerning the reign of Emperor Kanmu were written with extra political consideration.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: 天皇の心痛となった早良親王廃太子の記事は、事件の発端となった藤原種継暗殺事件とともに、いったん記載されたものが後に削除された。
sen.e: The Emperor was distressed at an article on the disinherited Imperial Prince Sawara, and the article was once put in the book, but later it was deleted, along with an article on the assassination of FUJIWARA no Tanetsugu.

The Emperor was distressed by an article on the disinherited Imperial Prince Sawara, and the article was therefore included in the book; later, however, it was deleted along with an article on the assassination of FUJIWARA no Tanetsugu.

The article on the disinherited Imperial Prince Sawara, by which the Emperor was distressed, was once included in the book, however it was deleted along with the article on the assassination of FUJIWARA no Tanetsugu; both articles triggered the incident.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: 削除部は平城天皇の代に復活したが、嵯峨天皇によって再び消されて今に至る。
sen.e: The deleted articles were re-entered during the reign of Emperor Heijo, but they were deleted again by Emperor Saga.
The deleted articles were re-entered during the reign of Emperor Heijo, but they were again deleted by Emperor Saga.
The deleted articles were re-entered during the reign of Emperor Heijo, but Emperor Saga deleted them again.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: 消された部分は『日本紀略』に採録されている。
sen.e: Those articles were recorded in "Nihongi Ryaku" (Summary of Japanese Chronologies).
Those articles were recorded in "Nihongi Ryaku (Summary of Japanese Chronologies").
Those articles were recorded in "Nihongi Ryaku" (Summary of Japanese Chronologies).
sen.cmt: " の場所を変更しました。

sen.j: この背景には早良親王が怨霊になったとする説と関係があると言われている。
sen.e: This seems to have had something to do with a tradition that Imperial Prince Sawara became a vengeful ghost.
This seems to have had something to do with the legend that Imperial Prince Sawara had become a vengeful ghost.
This seems to have had something to do with the legend that Imperial Prince Sawara had become a vengeful ghost.

sen.j: また、藤原広嗣の乱における謀反人・藤原広嗣に対する好意的な記事が含まれているという説もある。
sen.e: Some people say that an article about FUJIWARA no Hirotsugu, a rebel in the Fujiwara no Hirotsugu War was presented in a good light, and articles about both a plot of Usa Hachiman-gu oracle and Dokyo, a Buddhist priest, contain political intention.

Some people say that an article about FUJIWARA no Hirotsugu, a rebel in the Fujiwara no Hirotsugu War, was presented in a good light, and articles about both a plot by the oracle Usa Hachiman-gu and Dokyo, a Buddhist priest, contain political intent.
Some people say that an article about FUJIWARA no Hirotsugu, a rebel in the Fujiwara no Hirotsugu War, was presented in a good light.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: さらに、宇佐八幡宮神託事件及び道鏡に関する記述に政治的意図が含まれているという説もある。
sen.e: Moreover, there is a view that articles about both a plot by the oracle of Usa Hachiman-gu Shrine and Dokyo, a Buddhist priest, contained political intent.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: ただし、『日本書紀』と比べれば、続紀の信頼性はずっと高いと考えられている。
sen.e: However, compared with "Nihon Shoki," Shoku Nihongi is considered more reliable.
However, compared with "Nihon Shoki," Shoku Nihongi is considered more reliable.
Compared with "Nihon Shoki," however, Shoku Nihongi is considered much more reliable.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: “天平文化”をとりまく諸側面を解明し、本格的な実録として最初に整備された史書である。
sen.e: It elucidated various aspects of the "Tenpyo culture," and was the first history book that was organized as full-scale true records.
It elucidated various aspects of the "Tenpyo culture," and was the first history book organized as a set of accurate, full-scale records.
It is the first history book which was organized as a set of accurate, full-scale records, elucidating various aspects of the "Tenpyo culture."
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: 『続日本紀』には、『官曹事類』と『外官事類』が付属した。
sen.e: "Shoku Nihongi" was followed by records of "Kanso Jirui" and "Gekan Jirui" (Classified Guide for Provincial Officials).
sen.cmt: 官曹事類の定訳は不明ですが、記録のようなものです。
sen.e: "Shoku Nihongi" was followed by the records of "Kanso Jirui" and "Gekan Jirui (Classified Guide for Provincial Officials").
"Shoku Nihongi" was followed by the records of "Kanso Jirui" (Classified Materials as an Aid to Officials) and "Gekan Jirui (Classified Guide for Provincial Officials").
sen.cmt: 官曹事類→Kanso Jirui (Classified Materials as an Aid to Officials) [参考：http://books.google.com/books?id=7jDuhnI6r9UC&pg=PA119&dq=gekan+jirui&as_brr=3&hl=ja#v=onepage&q=gekan%20jirui&f=false]

sen.j: 前者は本文に掲載しなかった文書類を原文そのままに項目別に配列したものである。
sen.e: The former consist of the categorized original documents which had been deleted from the book, while the contents of the latter records are unknown, but it seems to have been similar to the former.

The former consisted of the categorized original documents that had been deleted from the book, while the contents of the latter records are unknown; however, it seems to have been similar to the former.
The former consisted of the categorized original documents that had been omitted from the book.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: 後者は内容不明でおそらく前者に似たものであろう。
sen.e: The contents of the latter records are unknown, but it seems to have been similar to the former.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: どちらも失われた。
sen.e: Both of them were lost.
Both of them have been lost.
Both records were lost.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。
